title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. IV, subch. A, Uniform Child Custody Jurisdiction and Enforcement Act (UCCJEA) Forms, UCCJEA-16 - Objection to the registration of an out-of-state custody or visitation order - UCCJEA
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. IV, subch. A, Uniform Child Custody Jurisdiction and Enforcement Act (UCCJEA) Forms, UCCJEA-16 - Objection to the registration of an out-of-state custody or visitation order - UCCJEA
State Regulations
DRL § 77-d Form UCCJEA-16

Objection to the Registration of

Out-of-State Child

Custody or Visitation Order--UCCJEA
8/2002
________
In the Matter of the Registration of
an

Out-of-State Custody or Visitation

Order

Pursuant to the Uniform Child Custody

Jurisdiction and Enforcement Act Docket No. OBJECTION TO THE REGISTRATION
OF OUT-OF-STATE CHILD
CUSTODY OR VISITATION
ORDER--UCCJEA
Petitioner
-against-
Respondent
________
I [specify name]: object to the
registration of the custody or visitation order submitted to this Court for
registration by the Petitioner that names the following child(ren): Name(s) of Child(ren) Date(s) of

Birth

In support of this objection, I allege the
following [check applicable box(es)]: The court that issued the order did not
have jurisdiction, because [specify]: The custody or visitation order sought to
be registered has been vacated, stayed or modified by a court having
jurisdiction as follows [specify, including court and date, and attach
certified copy of the order vacating, staying or modifying the order sought to
be registered]: I was entitled to notice before the
custody or visitation order was made, but notice was not given according to the
standards of Section 75-g of the New York State Domestic Relations Law. Date: ______________
Person Filing Objection (Print or Type

Name)
______________
Address of Person Filing

Objection[FN1]
______________
Signature of Attorney, if any
______________
Attorney's Name, if any (Print or

Type)
______________
Attorney's Address and Telephone

Number
CERTIFICATE OF MAILING
I mailed this objection on [specify date]: ____________. ________ (Signature)
[FN1] Specify if address has been ordered
to be kept confidential pursuant to Domestic Relations Law §§ 76-h, 254 or Family Court Act § 154-b. If your health or safety or that of your
child or children would be put at risk by disclosure of your address, you may
apply for address confidentiality by submitting General Form GF-21, which is
available at www.courts.state.ny.us (Family Court forms). Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. IV, subch. A, Uniform Child

Custody Jurisdiction and Enforcement Act (UCCJEA) Forms, UCCJEA-16

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
